bug.description:
Hi make install fails on ubuntu 17.10 and fallback to fedora(?) dnf install. I do know if would make sense to handle this also for ubuntu 18 which is going to be released Also is unavaliable in ubuntu after 17.04 A workaround is here <denchmark-link:https://stackoverflow.com/a/48326450/833499>https://stackoverflow.com/a/48326450/833499</denchmark-link>
<denchmark-code>sudo add-apt-repository "deb http://security.ubuntu.com/ubuntu xenial-security main" sudo apt update sudo apt install libjasper-dev </denchmark-code>
Thanks!

comments.comment: Any one able to create a PR with changes to the Makefile to accommodate this?

I think disabling jpeg2000 support in opencv is a saner solution (nobody uses this format) than modifying the host's apt configuration to fetch from old releases (and not a backport proper). Testing locally with sudo apt remove libjasper-dev then doing a full rebuild with WITH_JASPER=OFF

Yes I agree, your solution is saner definitely!
